optionalfeature.name: Natural Resilience Balm
entries: The creature gains the effect of {@spell mage armor|Ishiir} without expending spellslots.

You touch a willing creature who isn't wearing armor, and a protective magical force surrounds it until the spell ends. The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier. The spell ends if the target dons armor or if you dismiss the spell as an action.

optionalfeature.name: Salve of Stoneskin
entries: The creature gains +1 to AC.

optionalfeature.name: Blessed Balm
entries: The creature can roll a {@dice d4} and add that to their saving throws and ability checks. They can use the {@dice d4} a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Lucky Salve
entries: When an enemy creature hits the creature with a critical hit, they can use their reaction to change it into a regular hit. They can use this ability once. Starting at 12th level, they can use this ability twice while the salve is active on them.

optionalfeature.name: Salve of Awareness
entries: The creature can not be surprised for the next 24 hours.

optionalfeature.name: Balm of the Slippery Fish
entries: When this creature provokes opportunity attacks, the attacker takes the attack with disadvantage.

optionalfeature.name: Salve of Nimbleness
entries: The speed of the creature increases by 5 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Salve of Strength
entries: You are considered one size larger for purposes of lifting and carrying weight, as well as for grappling and shoving (whether you are the one doing it or the one it's being done to), escaping from nets, or any effect that creatures gain advantage against or immunity to based on being at least a certain size.

optionalfeature.name: Salve of the Empty Mind
entries: The creature gains advantage on saving throws against being {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} and {@condition Frightened|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Giants Balm
entries: The creature gains proficiency in STR saving throws. If the creature is already proficient double the proficiency.

optionalfeature.name: Tiger's Balm
entries: The creature gains proficiency in DEX saving throws. If the creature is already proficient double the proficiency.

optionalfeature.name: Vitamine Boost
entries: The creature gains proficiency in CON saving throws. If the creature is already proficient double the proficiency.

optionalfeature.name: Salve of the Shadow
entries: The creature gains proficiency in Stealth(DEX) checks. If the creature is already proficient double the proficiency. If already double proficient gain advantage.

optionalfeature.name: Balm of the Quickened
entries: The creature gains advantage on their initiative roll.

optionalfeature.name: Warriors Balm
entries: The creature gains +1 to Attack rolls and damage made with simple and martial weapons.

optionalfeature.name: Salve of Rest
entries: The creature recovers 1 hitdie and the next hitdie they spend is maximized.

optionalfeature.name: Mages Balm
entries: The creature gains back spellslots equal to your proficiency bonus. When the creature gains this effect they can choose spell slots to recover. The spell slots can have a combined level that is equal to or less than your proficiency bonus.
For example, if you're a 10th-level Apothecary, They can recover up to 4 levels worth of spell slots.
A creature can only gain this effect once per long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Dragons Salve
entries: The creature gains the ability to use a Dragons Breath once during the bonus action of drinking the Tonic using your Tonic save DC.
In a 20 feet cone the creature breaths either acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison dealing {@damage 6d6} to all creatures who fail a Dexterity saving throw and half on a successful save.

optionalfeature.name: Balm of the Mermaid
entries: The creature gains the ability to breathe underwater and has a swimming speed equal to their walking speed.

optionalfeature.name: Salve of the Stampede
entries: The creature gains temporary hit points when they kill a creature equal to half of the damage dealt.

optionalfeature.name: Slimey Salve
entries: The creature gains the ability to move through any space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing, and you can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or being {@condition Grappled|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Emergency Balm
entries: The creature can use their action to touch and heal a creature for 1 hp. They can do so an amount of times equal to their proficiency bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Booster Balm
entries: The creature gains hitpoints equal to your Apothecary level when it gains hitpoints from healing effects.

optionalfeature.name: Salve of Resistance
entries: The creature gains resistance to one of the following damage types: Blunt, Slashing, Piercing, Fire, Cold, Lightning, Poison, Acid, Necrotic.

optionalfeature.name: Greater Salve of Nimbleness
entries: The speed of the creature increases by 10 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Deathwarding Balm
entries: The creature gains the effect of the {@spell deathward|Ishiir} spell: The first time the target would drop to 0 hit points as a result of taking damage, the target instead drops to 1 hit point, and the effect ends.

If the effect is still in effect when the target is subjected to an effect that would kill it instantaneously without dealing damage, that effect is instead negated against the target, and the effect ends.

optionalfeature.name: Salve of Freedom of Movement
entries: The creature gains the effect of the {@spell freedom of movement|Ishiir} spell.

For the duration, the target's movement is unaffected by {@quickref difficult terrain||3}, and spells and other magical effects can neither reduce the target's speed nor cause the target to be {@condition Paralyzed|Ishiir} or {@condition Restrained|Ishiir}.

The target can also spend 5 feet of movement to automatically escape from nonmagical restraints, such as manacles or a creature that has it {@condition Grappled|Ishiir}. Finally, being underwater imposes no penalties on the target's movement or attacks.

optionalfeature.name: Salve of the Unseen
entries: The creature gains {@sense blindsight} of 15ft. If the creature already has {@sense blindsight} extend the range of it by 15ft.

optionalfeature.name: Greater Salve of the Empty Mind
entries: The creature immune to being {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} and {@condition Frightened|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Greater Giants Balm
entries: The creature gains proficiency in STR saving throws and a +3 to STR checks. If the creature is already proficient double the proficiency.

optionalfeature.name: Greater Tiger's Balm
entries: The creature gains proficiency in DEX saving throws and a +3 to DEX checks. If the creature is already proficient double the proficiency.

optionalfeature.name: Greater Vitamine Boost
entries: The creature gains proficiency in CON saving throws and a +3 to CON checks. If the creature is already proficient double the proficiency.

optionalfeature.name: Fey's Protective Salve
entries: The creature can choose to gain advantage on saving throws to resist spells and other magical effects. They can use this feature once.

optionalfeature.name: Hasty Balm
entries: The creature gains the ability to use a bonus action to attack with their weapon once per round. On the 4rd time after using this bonus action they become lethargic and can't move or take actions until the end of their next turn, as a wave of lethargy sweeps over it. The salve then ends on the creature. If the creature is dual wielding they can make both an attack with their main hand and off hand.

optionalfeature.name: Balm of Iron
entries: The creature gains +2 AC and gains Immutable Form. The creature is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

optionalfeature.name: Speech Salve
entries: The creature chooses one language when this salve is applied, this language can be any language. Till the next rest they can speak this language.

optionalfeature.name: Greater Salve of the Shadow
entries: When standing still they become {@condition Invisible|Ishiir}. In addition, The creature gains proficiency in Stealth(DEX) checks. If the creature is already proficient double the proficiency. If already double proficient gain +10 to the roll.

optionalfeature.name: Salve of Wings
entries: The creature gains a flying speed equal to their movement speed.

optionalfeature.name: Greater Balm of the Warrior
entries: The creature gains +2 to Attack rolls made with simple and martial weapons and +2 to damage.

optionalfeature.name: Salve of Blinking
entries: The creature gains the ability to teleport 15ft as a bonus action during their turn.

optionalfeature.name: Salve of Healing
entries: The creature gains 1 HP per round if below half max HP.

optionalfeature.name: Salve of the Wilds
entries: The creature gains the ability to use their action to magically assume the shape of a beast that they have seen before with a maximum CR of 10. They can stay in a beast shape for a number of hours equal to half their level (rounded down). They can revert to their normal form earlier by using a bonus action on their turn. They automatically revert if they fall unconscious, drop to 0 hit points, or die.
While you are transformed, the following rules apply:

items: Your game statistics are replaced by the statistics of the beast, but you retain your alignment, personality, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores. You also retain all of your skill and saving throw proficiencies, in addition to gaining those of the creature. If the creature has the same proficiency as you and the bonus in its stat block is higher than yours, use the creature's bonus instead of yours. If the creature has any legendary or lair actions, you can't use them.

When you transform, you assume the beast's hit points and Hit Dice. When you revert to your normal form, you return to the number of hit points you had before you transformed. However, if you revert as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to your normal form. For example, if you take 10 damage in animal form and have only 1 hit point left, you revert and take 9 damage. As long as the excess damage doesn't reduce your normal form to 0 hit points, you aren't knocked {@condition Unconscious|Ishiir}.

You can't cast spells, and your ability to speak or take any action that requires hands is limited to the capabilities of your beast form. Transforming doesn't break your {@condition Concentration|Ishiir} on a spell you've already cast, however, or prevent you from taking actions that are part of a spell, such as {@spell call lightning|Ishiir}, that you've already cast. You retain the benefit of any features from your class, race, or other source and can use them if the new form is physically capable of doing so. However, you can't use any of your special senses, such as {@sense darkvision}, unless your new form also has that sense.

You choose whether your equipment falls to the ground in your space, merges into your new form, or is worn by it. Worn equipment functions as normal, but the DM decides whether it is practical for the new form to wear a piece of equipment, based on the creature's shape and size. Your equipment doesn't change size or shape to match the new form, and any equipment that the new form can't wear must either fall to the ground or merge with it. Equipment that merges with the form has no effect until you leave the form.

optionalfeature.name: Change of Shape Salve
entries: The creature gains the ability to use their action to magically assume the form of a different creature till the next short or long rest or you use a free action to dismiss it. The new form can be of any creature with a challenge rating equal to your level or lower. The creature can't be a construct or an undead, and you must have seen the sort of creature at least once. They transform into an average example of that creature, one without any class levels or the Spellcasting trait.
While you are transformed, the following rules apply:

items: Your game statistics are replaced by the statistics of the chosen creature, though you retain your alignment and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores. You also retain all of your skill and saving throw proficiencies, in addition to gaining those of the creature. If the creature has the same proficiency as you and the bonus listed in its statistics is higher than yours, use the creature's bonus in place of yours. You can't use any legendary actions or lair actions of the new form.

You assume the hit points and Hit Dice of the new form. When you revert to your normal form, you return to the number of hit points you had before you transformed. If you revert as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to your normal form. As long as the excess damage doesn't reduce your normal form to 0 hit points, you aren't knocked {@condition Unconscious|Ishiir}.

You retain the benefit of any features from your class, race, or other source and can use them, provided that your new form is physically capable of doing so. You can't use any special senses you have (for example, {@sense darkvision}) unless your new form also has that sense. You can only speak if the creature can normally speak.

When you transform, you choose whether your equipment falls to the ground, merges into the new form, or is worn by it. Worn equipment functions as normal. The DM determines whether it is practical for the new form to wear a piece of equipment, based on the creature's shape and size. Your equipment doesn't change shape or size to match the new form, and any equipment that the new form can't wear must either fall to the ground or merge into your new form. Equipment that merges has no effect in that state.

optionalfeature.name: Salve of Life Giving

prerequisite.other: A diamond worth 1000gp that is grinded down and dissolved in the Salve

entries: As an action the creature can touch another creature that has not been dead for more than a century. The creature comes back to life with full health and their body and mind fully restored. After using this action the effect of the salve disappears. A creature that has been revived with this feature in the last 100 years this way only gains 1 hitpoint back and has disadvantage on all saving throws and checks till the end of their next long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Salve of Death Giving
entries: As an action the creature goes into a strengthened state for 1 minute. During this time the creature has advantage on all attacks and creatures attacking him/her have disadvantage.

optionalfeature.name: Balm of Telepathy
entries: The creature gains {@language telepathy|Ishiir} as described in the Monster manual. Telepathy is a magical ability that allows a monster to communicate mentally with another creature within a specified range. The contacted creature doesn't need to share a language with the monster to communicate in this way with it, but it must be able to understand at least one language. A creature without telepathy can receive and respond to telepathic messages but can't initiate or terminate a telepathic conversation.

A telepathic monster doesn't need to see a contacted creature and can end the telepathic contact at any time. The contact is broken as soon as the two creatures are no longer within range of each other or if the telepathic monster contacts a different creature within range.

A telepathic monster can initiate or terminate a telepathic conversation without using an action, but while the monster is incapacitated, it can't initiate telepathic contact, and any current contact is terminated.
A creature within the area of an antimagic field or in any other location where magic doesn't function can't send or receive telepathic messages.

optionalfeature.name: Balm of the Ghost
entries: As an action the creature can go through solid matter for 1 minute but cannot touch anything but the ground during this time.

optionalfeature.name: Blessed Tonic
entries: As an action you can throw a blessed Tonic at a creature within 40 feet This effect lasts for 5 turns. The creature effected by this tonic adds {@dice 1d6} to all attack rolls and saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Healing Tonic
entries: As an action you can throw a healing Tonic at a creature within 40 feet healing them for {@damage 2d4} + your intelligence modifier. The healing increases at 5th level ({@damage 4d4}) 10th ({@damage 8d4}) 14th ({@damage 10d4}) 18th ({@damage 12d4}).

optionalfeature.name: Revealing Tonic
entries: As an action you can make a thrown Tonic attack within 40 feet, on hit it deals no damage but the creature cannot become {@condition Invisible|Ishiir} unless they use an action to remove the Tonic from themselves. In addition to that attacks against them have Advantage.

optionalfeature.name: Cloud in a Bottle
entries: As an Action you can throw a Tonic within a 40 feet range of you. When the Tonic hits the ground it makes a heavily obscured area of a 20 foot radius.

optionalfeature.name: Grease
entries: As an action you can throw a bottle of grease within 40 feet. Slick grease covers the ground in a 10-foot radius centered on a point within range and turns it into difficult terrain for the duration.

When the grease appears, each creature standing in its area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or fall prone. A creature that enters the area or ends its turn there must also succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or fall {@condition Prone|Ishiir}.
At 10th level this area of effect increases to 20 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Bottle of Acid
entries: As an action you can throw a bottle of acid within 40 feet of you. All creatures within a 10 foot radius must make a dexterity saving throw against your Tonic save DC. They take {@damage 2d8} acid damage and every turn after that another {@damage 1d4}. If they save they take half the damage and the other effect does not happen.
The damage increases at 5th level ({@damage 4d8}), 10th level ({@damage 6d8}), 14th level ({@damage 8d8}), 18th level ({@damage 10d8}).

optionalfeature.name: Tonic of Gravity
entries: As an action you can make a thrown Tonic attack within 40 feet, on hit you deal {@damage 2d8} force damage and force the creature to make a constitution saving throw. On a Failure they are knocked {@condition Prone|Ishiir} and their speed is halved till the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Tonic of Recovery
entries: As an action you can rub this tonic on a creatures skin. After that it heals for 1 hp every round for the next 10 rounds. This tonic increases in potency at certain levels, 5th level (15 rounds), 10th level (20 rounds), 14th level (25 rounds), 18th (30 rounds)

optionalfeature.name: Tonic of Displacement
entries: As a bonus action you can drink this Tonic, your body begins to vibrate making you hard to hit and melee attack rolls have disadvantage against you.

optionalfeature.name: Tonic of the Clear Mind
entries: As an action you can administer this Tonic to a creature, when you do so the following conditions end on the creature: {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} and {@condition Frightened|Ishiir}. If the creature is possessed the possesser makes a wisdom saving throw against your Tonic DC, if it fails the possession ends.

optionalfeature.name: Bottle of Flames
entries: As an action you can throw a bottle of fire within 40 feet of you. All creatures within a 10 foot radius must make a dexterity saving throw against your Tonic save DC. They take {@damage 5d6} fire damage and every turn after that another {@damage 1d4}. If they save they take half the damage and the other effect does not happen.
The damage increases at 10th level ({@damage 7d6}), 14th level ({@damage 9d6}), 18th level ({@damage 11d6}).

optionalfeature.name: Tonic of Non-breathing
entries: As an action a creature can drink this Tonic when they do so they do not have to breathe for the next 4 hours.

optionalfeature.name: Tonic of Healing
entries: As an action a creature can drink this Tonic, for the next 5 turns they can use their bonus action to heal {@dice 2d6}.

optionalfeature.name: Tonic of Enchantment
entries: As an action you can pour this Tonic over a weapon, It gains a +1 to damage and attack rolls and counts as magical.

optionalfeature.name: Tonic of the Mired Mind
entries: As an action you can make a thrown Tonic attack within 40 feet, on hit it deals no damage but the creatures speed is halved, it takes a -2 penalty to AC and Dexterity saving throws and it cannot use reactions. On its turn it can either use an action or bonus action but not both. Regardless of the creature's abilities or magic items, it can't make more than one melee or ranged attack during its turn. If the creature attempts to cast a spell with a casting time of 1 action, roll a d20. On an 11 or higher, the spell doesn't take effect until the creature's next turn, and the creature must use its action on that turn to complete the spell. If it can't, the spell is wasted. This effect lasts for 5 rounds.

optionalfeature.name: Tonic of the Clear Body
entries: As an Action you can administer this Tonic to a creature, when you do so you can end either one disease or one condition afflicting it. The condition can be {@condition Blinded|Ishiir}, {@condition Deafened|Ishiir}, {@condition Paralyzed|Ishiir}, or {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Tonic of Revival

prerequisite.other: Special herbs costing 300gp that are in the Tonic

entries: As an action pour the Tonic on a creature that has died within the last minute. That creature returns to life with 1 hit point. This Tonic can't return to life a creature that has died of old age, nor can it restore any missing body parts.

optionalfeature.name: Unstable Tonic
entries: As an action a creature can drink this Tonic, for the next 5 turns they can use their bonus action to teleport 60 feet to a unoccupied space they can see.

optionalfeature.name: Tonic of Silence
entries: As an action you can make a thrown Tonic attack within 40 feet, on hit it deals no damage but the creature is silenced for the next 5 turns. At the end of each of its turns it can make a constitution saving throw against your Tonic save DC.

optionalfeature.name: Tonic of Paralysis
entries: As an action you can make a thrown Tonic attack within 40 feet, on hit it deals no damage but the creature is {@condition Paralyzed|Ishiir} for the next 5 turns. At the end of each of its turns it can make a constitution saving throw against your Tonic save DC.

optionalfeature.name: Tonic of Skill
entries: As an action a creature can drink this Tonic and for the next 24 hours can double their proficiency of one of their skills or tools.

optionalfeature.name: Tonic of a Changed Mind
entries: As an action you can make a thrown Tonic attack within 40 feet, on hit it deals no damage but the creature is Charmed for the next 5 turns. At the end of each of its turns it can make a Wisdom saving throw against your Tonic save DC. During this charm you can modify their memory of the last 24 hours.

optionalfeature.name: Burning Tonic
entries: As an action you can make a thrown Tonic attack within 40 feet, on hit it deals {@damage 10d6} Fire damage. At the end of each turn they make a Dexterity saving throw against your Tonic save DC, on a failure they take {@damage 1d6} Fire damage.

optionalfeature.name: Acidic Tonic
entries: As an action you can make a thrown Tonic attack within 40 feet, on hit it deals {@damage 10d6} Acid damage. At the end of each turn they make a Dexterity saving throw against your Tonic save DC, on a failure they take {@damage 1d6} Acid damage.

optionalfeature.name: Tonic of Cheated Death
entries: As an action a creature can drink this Tonic, for the next 24 hours if they would drop to 0 hit points they drop to 1 instead. If an effect would kill the creature instantly the effect fails.

optionalfeature.name: Spray of Flight
entries: As an action spray this Tonic in a 10 foot cone, you and all creatures within the cone gain a flying speed of 60 for the next 8 hours. If a creature lands before the end of the Tonic the Tonic fades immediately.

optionalfeature.name: Tonic of Evasion
entries: As an Action a creature can drink this Tonic, when they do for the next 5 rounds they gain Evasion: If the creature is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the creature instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

optionalfeature.name: Tonic of Protection
entries: As an Action a creature can drink this Tonic, when they do for the next 5 rounds they have an increased AC +2.

optionalfeature.name: Bottle of Poison
entries: As an action you can make a thrown Tonic attack within 40 feet, on hit it deals {@damage 10d6} Poison damage. At the end of each turn they make a constitution saving throw against your Tonic save DC, on a failure they take {@damage 1d6} Poison damage.

optionalfeature.name: Bottle of Cold
entries: As an action you can make a thrown Tonic attack within 40 feet, on hit it deals {@damage 10d6} Cold damage. At the end of each turn they make a constitution saving throw against your Tonic save DC, on a failure they take {@damage 1d6} Cold damage.

optionalfeature.name: Tonic of Invisibility
entries: As an Action a creature can drink this Tonic, when they do for the next 5 rounds they are {@condition Invisible|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Bottle of Frost
entries: As an action you can make a thrown Tonic attack within 40 feet, on hit it deals {@damage 7d8+30} Cold damage and they have disadvantage on attacks till the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Tonic of Greater Healing
entries: As an action a creature can drink this Tonic and recover 70 hit points and all hit point reductions are removed.

optionalfeature.name: Tonic of Truesight
entries: As an Action a creature can drink this Tonic, when they do for the next 4 hours the creature has 60 feet range {@sense truesight}: A creature with {@sense truesight} can, out to a specific range, see in normal and magical darkness, see {@condition Invisible|Ishiir} creatures and objects, automatically detect visual illusions and succeed on saving throws against them, and perceives the original for of a shapechanger or a creature that is transformed by magic. Furthermore, the creature can see into the ethereal plane.

optionalfeature.name: Tonic of Sustain
entries: As an Action a creature can drink this Tonic, when they do for the next 24 hours they do not need sleep, food or water and they do not age within that time.

optionalfeature.name: Tonic of Youth
entries: As an Action a creature can drink this Tonic, when they do they become {@dice 1d10} years younger. If this causes the creature to go under 0 years they disappear from existence.

optionalfeature.name: Tonic of The Minds
entries: As an Action a creature can drink this Tonic, when they do for the next 24 hours they gain proficiency in either Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Tonic of the Strong Body
entries: As an Action a creature can drink this Tonic, when they do for the next 24 hours they gain proficiency in either Strength, Dexterity or Constitution saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Tonic of Bladeward
entries: As an Action a creature can drink this Tonic, when they do for the next 8 hours they gain resistance to Slashing, bludgeoning and piercing damage.

optionalfeature.name: Tonic of Resistance
entries: As an Action a creature can drink this Tonic, when they do for the next 8 hours they gain resistance to either Acid, Cold, Fire or Poison damage.

optionalfeature.name: Bottle of Creeping Death
entries: As an action you can make a thrown Tonic attack within 40 feet, on hit it deals {@damage 7d12} Poison damage and they are {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir} for the next 5 rounds. At the end of each round they take {@damage 1d12} Poison damage.

optionalfeature.name: Legendary Tonic of Healing

prerequisite.other: 1000gp worth of herbs that are in the Tonic

entries: As an action a creature can drink this Tonic and recover 100 hit points and all hit point reductions, Curses and Conditions are removed.
